## Page.$() method

Runs `document.querySelector` within the page. If no element matches the selector, the return value resolves to `null`.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
$<T extends Element = Element>(selector: string): Promise<ElementHandle<T> | null>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  selector | string | A <code>selector</code> to query page for [selector](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Selectors) to query page for. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;[ElementHandle](./puppeteer.elementhandle.md)&lt;T&gt; \| null&gt;

## Remarks

Shortcut for [Page.mainFrame().$(selector)](./puppeteer.frame._.md).
